result.execSummary:
The defendant Bridget R Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bridget R Lee in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today: 15CF193 & 15CM501

1:35 pm. Court calls case.
Case is before the Court on a motion to amend sentence.
Atty Kryshak gives statements.
Atty Cousins indicates that victims have been notified on 15CF193. 

BY THE COURT:
Court does not allow reduced time on sentence for 15CF193.
Court allows 60 days to commence sentence.
Defendant to report today to the jail to receive start date.

15CM501
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Cousins states plea agreement.
Attorney Kryshak concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 

Ct 1: NO CONTEST
Ct 2: NO CONTEST

Atty Cousins strikes the repeater allegations.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders the repeater language stricken on the complaint.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Ct 1 & Ct 2.  
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
Ct 1: 
20 months probation concurrent to any probation already serving
Imposed/Stayed sentence 45 days jail
Pay DNA surcharge in Ct 1 only

Ct 2:
Imposed/Stayed sentence 90 days jail concurrent to count 1
20 months probation concurrent to count 1
Write a letter of apology to the agents involved in this case within 30 days
Comply with AODA assessment sign releases of information
Maintain absolute sobriety
Participate in any assessment counseling deemed appropriate by the agent 
Pay costs and surcharges
Huber priviledges for work/school and counseling and any other reason that the Sheriff will allow
Can serve second 45 days jail sentence with home monitoring if she qualifies

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Bridget R Lee
Current: 1600 Briggs, c/o Salvation Army, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 12-21-2015)
Prior: 2916 Lindbergh Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481

1:43 p.m. Defendant Bridget R Lee in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.  
Atty Kryshak requests that Day Report be notified.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  3 times per week
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
If goes to inpatient treatment and is verified by probation officer then will not need to Day Report; if in outpatient treatment then will need to Day Report.
Will need to contact Public Defender or her Atty Gary Kryshak

DA# 15PT2222
1:14 p.m.  ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of disorderly conduct and resisting/obstructing officer.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a signature bond of $1,000.00 with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  December 21, 2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1.
